result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. THOMAS R. GONZALES

records.addlTxt:
8:32 AM Attorney Ty Gasparek in court for THOMAS R. GONZALES.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Jeanne Struve in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant THOMAS R. GONZALES not in court. Atty Gasparek advises court as to Defendant's non-appearance and moves to reschedule approximately 60 days out.  Request granted.  Bond to continue.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

You shall report for fingerprinting and photos pursuant to Wis Stats 970.02(7).  Contact (920) 236-4906 IMMEDIATELY after your hearing to schedule an appointment.  You must bring your court hearing paperwork to your appointment. No contact with Neenah YMCA.

08:43 AM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Jeanne Struve in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant THOMAS R. GONZALES appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Ty Gasparek in court for THOMAS R. GONZALES. Given/has complaint. Waive reading. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
